p: Therefore, continuous surveillance of H2N9 and LPAI H7N9 is highly recommended to predict the potential spread of HPAI H7N9 in Korea. Other subtypes (H7N3, H9N2, and H11N9), have been co-circulating in Korea [ 18, 19, 20]. The NA gene of the H7N9 influenza virus is more closely related to that of H2N9 viruses found in migratory wild birds in Hong Kong in 2010â€“2011 during the evolution of HPAI H7N9 [ 14].
